page.title: 04INTERVIEW Holworthy Farm
page.content:
The family have nine horses for which there is a visiting blacksmith. We were also met by many dogs when we visited the farm, they were friendly but seemed determined to round up the car as we drove away. The livestock are fed on grass in the summer and concentrated silage in the winter. The farm is quite prosperous for in addition to the stock they posses three modern tractors and a cattle lorry.
The weather is fairly mild with only the occasional snowfall in winter and compensation is available from the government in the case of sheep being lost. The farm itself is partially self sufficient, relying on outside help at busy times of the year.
